qas.question: How many miles of hidden tunnel were on the island?
Who transformed the island into a fortress?
What were the pillboxes and bunkers connected by?
Who did the network of fortifications on the island favor?

context: From early 1944 until the days leading up to the invasion, <a1_0>Kuribayashi<a1_0/> transformed the island into a massive network of bunkers, hidden guns, and <a0_0>11<a0_0/> mi (18 km) of <a2_0>underground tunnels<a2_0/>. The heavy American naval and air bombardment did little but drive the Japanese further underground, making their positions impervious to enemy fire. Their pillboxes and bunkers were all connected so that if one was knocked out, it could be reoccupied again. The network of bunkers and pillboxes greatly favored <a3_0>the defender<a3_0/>.
